The Sonus will be Sung; in the following Order:—

Air. CYMON.—(Arne.)—You gave me last week a young linnet.
Song. TJSQANDA—(Sir John StnYenson)—One adieu before you leave me.
An: SVLVIA—Yet awhile sweet sleep deceive me.
Duet. CTMON and SYLVIA—(Bishop)—0, take this nosegay, gentle youth.

having been received throughout with the most enthusiastic ap*
plause, and announced for repetition amidst the acclamations
of overflowing audiences, will be repeated

Every Evening until further notice.

in c o n s e q u e n c e of t h e e n t h u s i a s t i c r e c e p t i o n of

Mr. GB&fiKES KESAN

l t » T A l i

T h e f i r s t a t t e m p t in this Country t o
was a t t e n d e d with success altogether unprecedented.

h e w i l l h a v e t h e h o n o u r of performing (for t h e first t i m e in London)
t h e C h a r a c t e r of H A 1 L E T t h i s E v e n i n g .

posed, from the great attraction of the NEW GRAND
DRAMATIC ORATORIO, that it will be performed in Passion Week, takes this opportunity
most respectfully of assuring the Public, that the
arrangements respecting its representation are so
itnperative, that the

will positively be on WednesdayffiFriday next.

ATTRACTION.

The Public is respectfully informed, that in consequence of Madame MAEIBRAN having
•extended her Engagement at Drury EaneTheatre to One More Night, the performance of

THE MARRIAGE OF FIGARO

is necessarily postponed until Friday next; when, in addition to the previous
Announcement of Talent,

S I S N O S

Z U C H E L L I

will have the honour of making his First Appearance on the English Stage.

T H E A T R E ROYAL, CQVENT GARDEN.
It Is respectfully announced, that In consequence of the attraction of

Madame M A U B H A J N T .
in her TWO POPULAR CHARACTERS 9
of La Sonnambula, & The Students of Jena.
she has been prevailed upon to perform them TO-NIGHT, at
this Theatre; inconsequence of which arrangment

The heavy Scenery and Machinery-

connected with those Dramas, will (by permission of Captain Polhill) be
removed on that occasion from Drury Lane Theatre. In addition to
which attraction

MADAME VESTMS

will perform her celebrated Character of KATE O'BRIEN.

O R , L I V I N G M O D E L S 10—Hercules
O F T H E and
A NLichas—Hercules
TIQUE

1—Hercules struggling with the Nemsen Lion, in the
Six well-known attitude*.
St—Achillea throwing tha Di.cus or Quoit.
3—Cincinnatuk, the Roman, fastening his Sandals.
4—The Slav. Emoleur, (the Grinder) sharpening his
knife while overhearing the Conipirators.
o—The Fighting- Gladiator, in thr.s beautiful positions.
(j—The African alarmed at the Thunder.
7—^jax defying the Lightning.
8 Homulus, from David's Picture of the Sabines.
$—Remus's defence, from the tame.
Tn conclude with the

clothing himself
in the Fatal Vest which Dejanair has sent him by the
youthful Lichas—He seizes the unfortunaU Boy by
the sole of the foot and hurls linn into the sea.
11—Horatius shielding his prostrate brother from the
uplifted weapon of the opposing Cnratii; the eldest
of whom is alterwards pourtuyed in the act of aiming
a deadly thrust at his adversary.
12—To conclude with the famous Positions of the dying
Gladiator.

In eonsequenoe of this Attraction, and the great expenee attendant
upon it, the Lessee is under the necessity of suspending all Privileges,
with the exception of the Public Press.

To-morrow, (1*< Time this Season) HEUe
S W I N N E . And A S O L D I E R ' S
On Saturday. (First Time this Season) the Opera of P R A D I A V O L O .

COURTSHIP

GUSTAVO'S THE THIRD.

Was performed on Monday, for the 35th successive Night,
and while Public Opinion has pronounced it to be one ofthe
most Splendid Dramas ever produced on the English Stage,
that Opinion has been confirmed by the largest Receipts ever
taken for such a continued Period, and particularly at this
Season of the Year. The Lessee has, therefore, the honor
of announcing that its Performance will be resumed on
Monday next; previous to which Evening, the Scenery,
Dresses, and Decorations, will be entirely renovated, m
order that the numerous Families now coming to Town may
have an opportunity of seeing it in all its original Splendour.
VivaFRtn. «t uVgina.

No Honey retttrgted.

Plt¥KTi

Was performed on Monday, for the 35th successive Night,
and while Public Opinion has pronounced it to he one ofthe
most Splendid Dramas ever produced on the English S t o e ,
t hat Opinion has been confirmed by the largest Receipt&|||er
taken for such a continued Period, and particularly n!AJni*
Season of the Year. The Lessee has, therefore, the honor
of announcing that its Performance will be resumed on
Monday next; previous to which Evening, the Scenerv,
Dresses, and Decorations, will he entirely renovated, in
order that the numerous Families now coming to Town may
have an opportunity of seeing it in all Its original Splendour.
